Touch the shutter button in the upper left to take a picture. If a delay is set, there will be a series of audible beeps starting 3 seconds before the picture is taken.

The buttons on the right allow you to control camera options as follows:
Delay: Cycles between picture delays of 5, 15, and 30 seconds, and no delay.
1 Pic/4 Pics: Toggle between taking a single picture, or four in succession.
Flash: Cycle between automatic, on, and off flash settings. Available only on Android 2.1 or later.
Switch Camera: Switches between rear and front-facing cameras. Available only on devices with multiple cameras and Android 2.3 or later.

After taking a picture, it will be shown with options to delete it, share it (via email/Facebook/Google+/etc), or return to the main screen. When taking 4 pictures, they will all be shown in a grid and you can view and delete individual pictures.

The Library button on the left shows a list of all pictures you have taken with CamTimer. Select one of the pictures to view it full screen, and delete or share it. The pictures are saved on your SD card in the CamTimer directory.
